hotels.name: The Fullerton Hotel Singapore
hotels.desc: Historic luxury hotel on waterfront, heritage building

hotels.name: Orchard Hotel
hotels.desc: Central location near shopping district, rooftop bar

restaurants.name: Food Opera
restaurants.desc: Food court atop ION Orchard, hawker favorites with a view

restaurants.name: Napoleon Wine Bistro
restaurants.desc: French-inspired wine bar, Telok Ayer conservation shophouse

restaurants.name: Empress
restaurants.desc: Modern Chinese at Asian Civilisations Museum, riverside setting

restaurants.name: Mitzo Restaurant & Bar
restaurants.desc: Cantonese fine dining at Grand Park Orchard, stylish decor

restaurants.name: Restaurant Labyrinth
restaurants.desc: Modern Singaporean fine dining, Michelin-starred, playful

restaurants.name: Smoke & Mirrors
restaurants.desc: Rooftop bar at National Gallery, skyline views, craft cocktails

restaurants.name: Jumbo Seafood
restaurants.desc: Famous chili crab, Clarke Quay riverside, tourist-friendly

restaurants.name: Hawker Chan
restaurants.desc: World's cheapest Michelin meal, soy sauce chicken rice

experiences.name: Marina Bay Sands
experiences.desc: Iconic hotel with observation deck and rooftop pool

experiences.name: Gardens by the Bay
experiences.desc: Futuristic gardens with Supertrees and conservatories

experiences.name: National Museum Singapore
experiences.desc: Singapore's history and culture through interactive exhibits

experiences.name: Singapore Botanic Gardens
experiences.desc: UNESCO heritage site, peaceful gardens and lakes

experiences.name: ArtScience Museum
experiences.desc: Unique lotus-shaped building with art and science exhibits

kidFriendly.name: Singapore Zoo
kidFriendly.desc: World-class zoo with diverse wildlife and interactive shows

kidFriendly.name: Universal Studios Singapore
kidFriendly.desc: Theme park with rides, shows, and attractions for families

kidFriendly.name: S.E.A. Aquarium
kidFriendly.desc: One of world's largest aquariums with interactive touch pools

kidFriendly.name: Sentosa Island Beaches
kidFriendly.desc: Family-friendly beaches with water sports and activities

markets.name: Chinatown Heritage Centre
markets.desc: Traditional shophouses, wet market, and cultural heritage

markets.name: Tekka Centre Market
markets.desc: Bustling multi-level wet market in Little India

markets.name: Bugis Street Market
markets.desc: Vibrant street market with clothing, trinkets, and street food

markets.name: Arab Street Bazaar
markets.desc: Colorful bazaar with textiles, fragrances, and spices

days.title: Marina Bay Arrival
activities: Arrival at Singapore, check into The Fullerton Hotel
Walk the Singapore waterfront
Visit Gardens by the Bay at dusk to see Supertrees
Dinner with views at Marina Bay restaurant

days.title: Culture and Heritage
activities: Morning at National Museum Singapore
Explore Chinatown and historic shophouses
Lunch at a heritage restaurant in Chinatown
Visit Chinese temples and heritage centre
Dinner at Hawker Chan for iconic meal

days.title: Fine Dining and Modern Singapore
activities: Morning at ArtScience Museum
Lunch at modern fine dining (Burnt Ends or Labyrinth)
Afternoon at Singapore Botanic Gardens
Evening cocktails at Smoke & Mirrors rooftop bar
Dinner experience at a Michelin-starred restaurant

days.title: Local Experiences and Shopping
activities: Breakfast at Food Opera with city views
Shopping in Orchard district
Lunch at Mitzo Restaurant in Orchard area
Visit local markets (Bugis or Arab Street)
Final dinner and exploration of Singapore's neighborhoods

days.title: Hawker Discovery
activities: Arrival in Singapore, settle into hotel
Lunch at iconic Hawker Chan for world's cheapest Michelin star
Explore Chinatown streets and heritage buildings
Dinner tour of hidden hawker stalls in different neighborhoods

days.title: Hidden Gems & Local Culture
activities: Breakfast at local hawker center
Visit Tekka Centre Market in Little India
Lunch at local Peranakan spot (Candlenut or National Kitchen)
Explore Arab Quarter and Bugis Street
Discover local bars and wine bistros (Napoleon Wine Bistro)
Casual dinner at neighborhood restaurant

days.title: Markets and Final Gems
activities: Morning market exploration (Arab Street or Chinatown)
Lunch at hidden local restaurant
Afternoon visit to Singapore Botanic Gardens
Late afternoon at a local food court (Food Opera)
Farewell dinner at a neighborhood gem restaurant
Final exploration of Singapore's street life
